availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Howes (Rowan County, farmer, lawyer, and soldier)

body.p: Rowan County, Kentucky, farmer, lawyer, and solider. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Susan Witten Howes on January 18, 1849. Father of Charles Howes and Hasvy Howes. Married to Mary Kelly on December 16, 1854. Father of Sarah J. Howes, Purmeld Howes, Amanda Howes, and James Howes. Farmer in Johnson County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Rowan County in 1860. Lawyer in October 1863. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia in Johnson County as adjutant from May 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:

Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 001912950, p. 43.
